00343 template<>
00344 template<typename eT>
00345 struct is_supported_complex< std::complex<eT> >
00346   { static const bool value = ( sizeof(std::complex<eT>) == 2*sizeof(eT) ); };

00370 template<typename T1>
00371 struct is_supported_elem_type
00372   {
00373   static const bool value = \
00374     is_u8<T1>::value ||
00375     is_s8<T1>::value ||
00376     is_u16<T1>::value ||
00377     is_s16<T1>::value ||
00378     is_u32<T1>::value ||
00379     is_s32<T1>::value ||
00380     is_float<T1>::value ||
00381     is_double<T1>::value ||
00382     is_supported_complex_float<T1>::value ||
00383     is_supported_complex_double<T1>::value;
00384   };
00385

00455 template<typename T1, typename T2>
00456 struct promote_type
00457   {
00458   inline static void check()
00459     {
00460     arma_static_assert<false> ERROR___UNSUPPORTED_MIXTURE_OF_TYPES;
00461     ERROR___UNSUPPORTED_MIXTURE_OF_TYPES = ERROR___UNSUPPORTED_MIXTURE_OF_TYPES;
00462     }
00463   
00464   typedef T1 result;
00465   };
00466

00472   };

00615 //
00616 //
00617 //
00618 
00619 
00620 //! upgrade_val is used to ensure an operation such as multiplication is possible between two types.
00621 //! values are upgraded only where necessary.
00622 //! used by:
00623 //! glue_div::apply_mixed(), glue_minus::apply_mixed(), glue_plus::apply_mixed(), glue_schur::apply_mixed()
00624 //! and glue_times::apply_mixed() via gemm_mixed().
00625 
00626 template<typename T1, typename T2>
00627 struct upgrade_val
00628   {
00629   typedef typename promote_type<T1,T2>::result T1_result;
00630   typedef typename promote_type<T1,T2>::result T2_result;
00631   
00632   inline
00633   static
00634   const typename promote_type<T1,T2>::result
00635   apply(const T1 x)
00636     {
00637     typedef typename promote_type<T1,T2>::result out_type;
00638     return out_type(x);
00639     }
00640   
00641   inline
00642   static
00643   const typename promote_type<T1,T2>::result
00644   apply(const T2 x)
00645     {
00646     typedef typename promote_type<T1,T2>::result out_type;
00647     return out_type(x);
00648     }
00649   
00650   };
00651 
00652 
00653 template<>
00654 template<typename T>
00655 struct upgrade_val<T,T>
00656   {
00657   typedef T T1_result;
00658   typedef T T2_result;
00659   
00660   inline static const T& apply(const T& x) { return x; }
00661   };
00662 
00663 
00664 //! upgrade a type to allow multiplication with a complex type
00665 //! e.g. the int in "int * complex<double>" is upgraded to a double
00666 template<>
00667 template<typename T, typename T2>
00668 struct upgrade_val< std::complex<T>, T2 >
00669   {
00670   typedef std::complex<T> T1_result;
00671   typedef T               T2_result;
00672   
00673   inline static const std::complex<T>& apply(const std::complex<T>& x) { return x;    }
00674   inline static const T                apply(const T2 x)               { return T(x); }
00675   };
00676 
00677 
00678 template<>
00679 template<typename T1, typename T>
00680 struct upgrade_val< T1, std::complex<T> >
00681   {
00682   typedef T               T1_result;
00683   typedef std::complex<T> T2_result;
00684   
00685   inline static const T                apply(const T1 x)               { return T(x); }
00686   inline static const std::complex<T>& apply(const std::complex<T>& x) { return x;    }
00687   };
00688 
00689 
00690 //! ensure we don't lose precision when multiplying a complex number with a higher precision real number
00691 template<>
00692 struct upgrade_val< std::complex<float>, double >
00693   {
00694   typedef std::complex<double> T1_result;
00695   typedef double               T2_result;
00696   
00697   inline static const std::complex<double> apply(const std::complex<float>& x) { return std::complex<double>(x); }
00698   inline static const double               apply(const double x)               { return x; }
00699   };
00700 
00701 
00702 template<>
00703 struct upgrade_val< double, std::complex<float> >
00704   {
00705   typedef double              T1_result;
00706   typedef std::complex<float> T2_result;
00707   
00708   inline static const double               apply(const double x)               { return x; }
00709   inline static const std::complex<double> apply(const std::complex<float>& x) { return std::complex<double>(x); }
00710   };
00711 
00712 
00713 //! ensure we don't lose precision when multiplying a complex numbers with different underlying types
00714 template<>
00715 struct upgrade_val< std::complex<float>, std::complex<double> >
00716   {
00717   typedef std::complex<double> T1_result;
00718   typedef std::complex<double> T2_result;
00719   
00720   inline static const std::complex<double>  apply(const std::complex<float>&  x) { return std::complex<double>(x); }
00721   inline static const std::complex<double>& apply(const std::complex<double>& x) { return x; }
00722   };
00723 
00724 
00725 template<>
00726 struct upgrade_val< std::complex<double>, std::complex<float> >
00727   {
00728   typedef std::complex<double> T1_result;
00729   typedef std::complex<double> T2_result;
00730   
00731   inline static const std::complex<double>& apply(const std::complex<double>& x) { return x; }
00732   inline static const std::complex<double>  apply(const std::complex<float>&  x) { return std::complex<double>(x); }
00733   };
00734 
00735 
00736 //! work around limitations in the complex class (at least as present in gcc 4.1 & 4.3)
00737 template<>
00738 struct upgrade_val< std::complex<double>, float >
00739   {
00740   typedef std::complex<double> T1_result;
00741   typedef double               T2_result;
00742   
00743   inline static const std::complex<double>& apply(const std::complex<double>& x) { return x; }
00744   inline static const double                apply(const float x)                 { return double(x); }
00745   };
00746 
00747 
00748 template<>
00749 struct upgrade_val< float, std::complex<double> >
00750   {
00751   typedef double               T1_result;
00752   typedef std::complex<double> T2_result;
00753   
00754   inline static const double                apply(const float x)                 { return double(x); }
00755   inline static const std::complex<double>& apply(const std::complex<double>& x) { return x; }
00756   };
00757 
00758 
00759 //! @}
